name: Hotel le Senat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Hotel le Senat on our first-ever visit to Paris in February 2007. We had the good fortune to be upgraded to a suite with a terrace with a view overlooking the entire city, with Sacre Coeur on the far horizon. When someone asked me what the best part of our trip was, I actually said "the view of Paris from our hotel room!"
reviews.title: This is a great hotel!

likes.liked: — View from the room, comfort and decor of room, friendly and helpful multilingual hotel staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The suite had a small entryway area with a desk, closet, and wc, and then a stairway leading up to landing where the main bathroom was located, and then one more step up to the bedroom which had a king bed, flatscreen tv, very modern little euro track lights all around, and a table and chairs, as well as the aforementioned terrace. The bathroom, as noted in other reviews, is all black and white marble and metal, heated towel racks, Hermes bath products, and our bathroom had a skylight as well. Just a terrific room with an unbelievable view.
reviews.title: Location Location Location

reviews.text: The staff at the hotel were very friendly and helpful, and were willing to coach us on our very poor French while also speaking very good English for those times when we just couldn't follow along. They were great wih directions and recommendations, helped us re-book our Eurostar tickets so that we could stay an extra night, and were just a pleasure to deal with under all circumstances.
reviews.title: Boutique Hotel...Concierge Service

reviews.text: The hotel location is excellent, with the Jardin de Luxembourg right across the street, and the whole St. Germain district right out the door. It is a short walk (10-15 min) to Notre Dame, and more like 25-30 mins to the Musee D'Orsay, Louvre, and Eiffel Tower. The RER station is also very close by, within about two blocks of the hotel. We found this train a little confusing to use compared to the Metro (because of the different platforms in the lower level at the Gare du Nord), but it is worth figuring out as it is only 3 stops from the hotel to Gare du Nord and many Metro connections.
reviews.title: An excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We did not have breakfast at the hotel so I can't comment on that, but there are many cafes within a few minutes walk and a little Tabac-type store right across the street for wine and fresh fruit etc.
reviews.title: Great Hotel in Perfect Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel le Senat was in a great location -- super close to the RER and Metro and in the middle of tons of cute restaurants, shops, the gardens, etc. We were able to walk to most places we visited. The rooms were small but clean and nice, and the staff were friendly enough. The breakfast was okay and was included in the price of our room -- not sure I would have paid for it otherwise. Would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After having read everything on Trip Advisor about this place, I can say that I wasn't disappointed at all. Yes, you must be prepared for the SMALL rooms. If this is the norm in Paris, than I think we did alright. The rooms are very modern. It was nice to have a safe too.
reviews.title: Loved the Latin Quarter

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel staff were very friendly and spoke perfect English. We had been worried about having no French language skills, but they were wonderful and were able to answer all of our questions. Breakfast was included and it was a great way to start off each morning.
reviews.title: Great little find in the latin quarter

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is excellent. The Saint Germaine Des Pres area has so much to offer. We were here during a Metro strike and we were able to walk to everything. The Arc Da Tremphe, The Eiffel Tower, The Louvre, The Luxemburg Gardens and Notre Dame Cathedral. The hop on, hop off boat tours on the Seine were a great way to travel during the metro strike. Well worth the money.
reviews.title: An Excellent Hotel
Loved this charming hotel
reviews.text: The bistros and restaurants in the area are plentiful. We didn't have one bad experience. Although when walking down the side roads for the first time, make sure to check out all the bistros before you get lured into one. Some are definately nicer than others. Even the pizza from the little vendors tastes amazing.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is located close to the beautiful Jardin de Luxembourg, which , on a sunny morning in October is a wondeful place to start the day with a croissant and a coffee. It is near to Luxembourg RER station. There are many restaurants and bistros nearby. There are 41 quietly, air conditioned rooms. Ours was located on the 5th of 6 floors. The room was clean, fairly spacious and had plenty of storage space. The bed was large and comfortable and had a kingsize feather duvet. The bathroom had a shower over the bath, hairdrier and had access to a seperate toilet. It was clean, well lit and modern. There was also a seperate shower and sink but this was a little cramped. There were two tv's, a mini-bar and a sofa bed. Heavy, black-out curtains hung the full length of the windows. There were no views from our room except for a small courtyard. We didn't eat at the hotel but breakfast can be taken in the room if desired for Euro 15 pp. There was a small bar adjacent to reception. Staff were helpful and friendly. The only reason I am not rating this above average is that the lift was out of order all weekend when we stayed. If we were to stay in this part of Paris again I would be more than happy to return to this hotel.
reviews.title: Comfortable, friendly and convenient

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Travel agent booked a Liberty Travel / GOGO package for a classic room with breakfast week 9/17-9/23. Asked for a garden view, got a very noisy street view room, because it was larger, but it had dirty carpet and soiled wallpaper. It did have a safe.
reviews.title: NOT REALLY A BOUTIQUE HOTEL

likes.liked: — internet access and safe in the room
likes.disliked: — room was tiny closet, was incredibly small

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are absolutely teenie weenie. cute photos on web site make the property look chic. Hotel was renovated in 2004, but it really needs to be freshend up.
reviews.title: Little gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room 307 had a desk chair and was too small for two people. We took room 305. We lived out of a suitcase for the week, no drawers, only four cubbies and a tiny closet. Black marble bathroom was small but clean and had hot water.
reviews.title: Great location but quite expensive

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Mauro, the night front desk man is a gem.
reviews.title: Great location, but not faultless

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have been to Paris several times and have stayed in several different hotels. Hotel Le Senat is now our favorite, and we will definitely stay there again. The hotel is charming and beautiful and has only 41 rooms. We have booked for a Duplex with terrace and it was definitely worth it. The room was a very nice size and had a private balcon, and a INCREDIBLE VIEW !!
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay in Hotel Le Senat

reviews.text: Buffet breakfast was very good
reviews.title: Not worth it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff was most helpful and very curteous, friendly. The location on the left bank is our favorite.
reviews.title: Great Paris pad!

likes.liked: — The location, the modern rooms and the lovely bathroom!

reviews.title: home away from home
reviews.text: The hotel is really easy to get. Take the RER line B to Luxembourg station and it is a five minute walk . The nearest Metro station (Odeon) is only a few minutes away.
We will definitely stay there again on our next visit to Paris.
reviews.title: Great location

description: The Le Senat in hotel Paris is an elegant hotel for those with exquisite taste. Our hotel is located in central Saint Germain, on the leftbank ( rive gauche) close to the Seine river, a hotel in the Latin Quarter, close to the breathtaking jardin du Luxembourg. A central paris hotel, in the most romantic region.
